commit_message:
Adds host_capabilities CRUD API operations

HostCapabilities is a database model containing host features or
capabilities that could be scheduled for instances that require them.

Adds CRUD operations for the new host_capabilities table.

Partially-Implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

Change-Id: I5ac69c0757a3642320984320921376c6e9dafb1c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/230812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def host_capabilities_get(context, host_capabilities_id): return _host_capabilities_get(context, host_capabilities_id) def _host_capabilities_get(context, host_capabilities_id, session=None): result = model_query(context, models.HostCapabilities, session=session).\ filter_by(id=host_capabilities_id).\ first() if not result: raise exception.NotFound() return result def host_capabilities_get_by_compute_node_id(context, compute_node_id): result = model_query(context, models.HostCapabilities, read_deleted='no').\ filter_by(compute_node_id=compute_node_id).\ first() if not result: raise exception.ComputeHostNotFound(host=compute_node_id) return result def host_capabilities_get_all(context): return model_query(context, models.HostCapabilities, read_deleted='no').all() def host_capabilities_create(context, values): """Creates a new HostCapabilities and populates the capacity fields with the most recent data. """ host_capabilities_ref = models.HostCapabilities() host_capabilities_ref.update(values) host_capabilities_ref.save() return host_capabilities_ref @oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry(max_retries=5, retry_on_deadlock=True) def host_capabilities_update(context, host_capabilities_id, values): """Updates the HostCapabilities record with the most recent data.""" session = get_session() with session.begin(): host_capabilities_ref = _host_capabilities_get( context, host_capabilities_id, session=session) values['updated_at'] = timeutils.utcnow() convert_objects_related_datetimes(values) host_capabilities_ref.update(values) return host_capabilities_ref def host_capabilities_delete(context, host_capabilities_id): """Delete a HostCapabilities record.""" session = get_session() with session.begin(): result = model_query(context, models.HostCapabilities, session=session).\ filter_by(id=host_capabilities_id).\ soft_delete(synchronize_session=False) if not result: raise exception.NotFound() ###################

Add py34 to tox.ini

Add py34 to tox.ini.
if encounter with error 'db type could not be determined',
please remove .testrepository/ and .tox/ first, then run
'tox -e py34'

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run.

This should eliminate the need to clean -x -i to kill pyc files in
your local directory to get tests to pass.

Change-Id: Ida103931d2ccb1e84fef06a29192ed43959ac15c

commit_message:
Update coverage to keystoneauth1

The .coveragerc file was pointing to the keystoneauth directory which no
longer exists. Update this to keystoneauth1.

Also remove the keystoneauth/openstack directory. This doesn't exist as
we don't have anything from oslo.incubator.

Change-Id: Icc4a4680bb9af5c2bfa230a5ffcf508740c06aae

commit_message:
Make  add_sample  use **kwargs & doc string update

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes add_sample of telemetry_client use **kwargs.
Also update doc string for the same.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I9a863d13319701362a5d364cb0a4afc6868d9f8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/82/252382/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def add_sample(self, sample_list, **kwargs): """Create the list for sample Available params: see http://developer.openstack.org/ api-ref-telemetry-v2.html#Addsamples """ sample = dict()
deleted_lines: def add_sample(self, sample_list, meter_name, meter_unit, volume, sample_type, resource_id, **kwargs): sample = {"counter_name": meter_name, "counter_unit": meter_unit, "counter_volume": volume, "counter_type": sample_type, "resource_id": resource_id}

commit_message:
policy restrain non-admin user image upload

There are some conditions exist where policy restrain the non-admin user to
update image in glance, in such conditions tempest test cases fails.

For catering this requirement new flag was introduced in tempest.conf
'image_upload_allowed' under [image] section. Its default value is true,
but in case non-admin user is not allowed to perform image upload,
value can be set to false, so that test cases are skipped rather
then getting failed.

Change-Id: I36899afa808fbc605968e96efbf9de347f95a17e
Closes-Bug: 1510905

* add/del nodes
* scale in/out
* policy attach/detach
* policy update

commit_message:
Make node-create return a location header

This patch makes node-create response return a location
header for node resource. Node is treated as a resource,
so action_id is not returned.

Change-Id: I0c829460bc80ddfa65ff76fbaddc573e31ac2ffe
partial-blueprint: http-response-modification

commit_message:
Add accessIPv4 and accessIPv6 when create server

nova support accessIPv4 and accessIPv6 as input param
but nova client don't support it as input param when
doing create operation.
Because it's already support in v2.1 so no microversion
introduced.

Change-Id: Idd50fe921f8c931ee28902f90ffdde6bfba34359
Closes-Bug: 1522359

commit_message:
Run py34 env first when launching tests

To resolve "db type could not be determined" when running tox
for the first time py34 environment need to laucnhed before py27.

commit_message:
Liberty doc updates for GlusterFS drivers

Change-Id: Ib13f2acc8d518e36594a6bbea95440d881b857b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/78/227078/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Create share - Delete share - Allow share access (rw) - Deny share access - With volume layout: - Create snapshot - Delete snapshot - Create share from shapshot- `glusterfs_share_layout` = <share layout used>; cf. :ref:`glusterfs_layouts`If Ganesha NFS server is used (``glusterfs_nfs_server_type = Ganesha``), then by default the Ganesha server is supposed to run on the Manila host and is managed by local commands. If it's deployed somewhere else, then it's managed via ssh, which can be configured by the following parameters: - `glusterfs_ganesha_server_ip` - `glusterfs_ganesha_server_username` - `glusterfs_ganesha_server_password` In lack of ``glusterfs_ganesha_server_password`` ssh access will fall back to key based authentication, using the key specified by ``glusterfs_path_to_private_key``. For further (non driver specific) configuration of Ganesha, see :doc:`ganesha`. Layouts has also their set of parameters, see :ref:`glusterfs_layouts` about that. .. _glusterfs_layouts: Layouts ------- New in Liberty, multiple share layouts can be used with glusterfs driver. A layout is a strategy of allocating storage backed resources for shares. There are two layouts implemented: - `directory mapped layout` (or `directory layout`, or `dir layout` for short): a share is backed by top-level subdirectories of a given volume. Directory mapped layout is the default and backward compatible with Kilo. The following setting explicitly specifies its usage: ``glusterfs_share_layout = layout_directory.GlusterfsDirectoryMappedLayout``. Options: - `glusterfs_target`: address of the volume that hosts the directories. If it's of the format `<glustervolserver>:/<glustervolid>`, then the Manila host is expected to be part of the GlusterFS cluster of the volume and GlusterFS management happens through locally calling the ``gluster`` utility. If it's of the format `<username>@<glustervolserver>:/<glustervolid>`, then we ssh to `<username>@<glustervolserver>` to execute ``gluster`` (`<username>` is supposed to have administrative privilees on `<glustervolserver>`). - `glusterfs_mount_point_base` = <base path of GlusterFS volume mounted on Manila host> (optional) - `volume mapped layout` (or `volume layout`, or `vol layout` for short): a share is backed by a whole GlusterFS volume. Volume mapped layout is new in Liberty. It can be chosen by setting ``glusterfs_share_layout = layout_volume.GlusterfsVolumeMappedLayout``. Options: - `glusterfs_servers` - `glusterfs_volume_pattern` Volume mapped layout is implemented as a common backend of the glusterfs and glusterfs-native drivers; see the description of these options in :doc:`glusterfs_native_driver`: :ref:`gluster_native_manila_conf`. Gluster NFS with volume mapped layout ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ A special configuration choice is :: glusterfs_nfs_server_type = Gluster glusterfs_share_layout = layout_volume.GlusterfsVolumeMappedLayout that is, Gluster NFS used to export whole volumes. All other GLusterFS backend configurations (including GlusterFS set up with glusterfs-native) require the ``nfs.export-volumes = off`` GlusterFS setting. GLuster NFS with volume layout requires ``nfs.export-volumes = on``. ``nfs.export-volumes`` is a *cluster-wide* setting, so a given GlusterFS cluster cannot host a share backend with Gluster NFS + volume layout and other share backend configurations at the same time. There is another caveat with ``nfs.export-volumes``: setting it to ``on`` without enough care is a security risk, as the default access control for the volume exports is "allow all". For this reason, while the ``nfs.export-volumes = off`` setting is automatically set by Manila for all other share backend configurations, ``nfs.export-volumes = on`` is *not* set by Manila in case of a Gluster NFS with volume layout setup. It's left to the GlusterFS admin to make this setting in conjuction with the associated safe guards.
deleted_lines: - Create NFS Share - Delete NFS Share - Allow NFS Share access * only 'rw' access - Deny NFS Share access- If the backend GlusterFS server runs on the Manila host machine, * `glusterfs_target` = <glustervolserver>:/<glustervolid> And if the backend GlusterFS server runs remotely, * `glusterfs_target` = <username>@<glustervolserver>:/<glustervolid>- `glusterfs_mount_point_base` = <base path of GlusterFS volume mounted on Manila host>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 18:49:07.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/utils.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/neutron/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rally/commit/20b05f2a513ffe88917bf53c5630d07f9b2a1022', 'message': 'Fix format of existing network in _get_or_create_network()

When running scenarios with the existing_networks plugin,
_get_or_create_network() returned the network object itself rather
than the Neutron-like return value of a dict with a single "network"
key, whose value was the network object. This fixes that error, and

Change-Id: I94a6bf6c1dae8060f7644dad36ea72a81a8b0701

commit_message:
Fix format of existing network in _get_or_create_network()

When running scenarios with the existing_networks plugin,
_get_or_create_network() returned the network object itself rather
than the Neutron-like return value of a dict with a single "network"
key, whose value was the network object. This fixes that error, and
adds an assertion to ensure that all return values from
_get_or_create_network() are of the correct format.

Change-Id: I94a6bf6c1dae8060f7644dad36ea72a81a8b0701
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/03/254903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: scenario._create_network = mock.Mock() if "networks" in context["tenant"]: self.assertEqual(network, context["tenant"]["networks"][0])

commit_message:
[Neutron] Fix _get_or_create_subnets() return value

neutron.utils.NeutronScenario._get_or_create_subnets has
a bug - if given network already has subnets then return
value is list of str, but should be list of dicts.

This is fixed, and proper unit test is reworked too

Change-Id: I5815c1f58437ec0de90a6a0350d5434a83c9bbc1

commit_message:
Migrate network client to SDK.

The previous patches have migrate all network commands to
the new version using sdk. This patch will remove the
temporary method, and implement a new make_client() to
create sdk network client.

And also, find() in openstackclient/network/common.py must
support sdk. The logic of this function will become much
easier than before, so this patch also removes two useless
test cases of find().

This patch will also remove the patched methods in tests.

Change-Id: Ic2f7bca073beb9757172d16f95d9b82c48cbbc12
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
Co-Authored-By: Terry Howe <terrylhowe@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Migrate "network show" command to use SDK.

This patch makes "network show" command use sdk.

Since we have to keep the other commands runnable with
the old network client, we use a temporary method to
create sdk network client. And as a result, the tests
need to patch a method to fake the temporary method,
which will be removed at last.

There are two same test cases in the unit tests. This
patch will remove one.

And since the output has changed, we also need to fix
function test cases.

Change-Id: I4c06b4efad2db430767bbaa882b0876df3ab483a
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
Co-Authored-By: Terry Howe <terrylhowe@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

added_lines: @mock.patch('openstackclient.network.v2.network._make_client_sdk') # The network to set. _network = network_fakes.FakeNetwork.create_one_network() columns = ( 'admin_state_up', 'id', 'name', 'router_external', 'status', 'subnets', 'tenant_id', ) data = ( network._format_admin_state(_network.admin_state_up), _network.id, _network.name, network._format_router_external(_network.router_external), _network.status, utils.format_list(_network.subnets), _network.tenant_id, ) self.network.find_network = mock.Mock(return_value=self._network) def test_show_all_options(self, _make_client_sdk): _make_client_sdk.return_value = self.app.client_manager.network self._network.name, ('identifier', self._network.name), columns, data = self.cmd.take_action(parsed_args) self.network.find_network.assert_called_with(self._network.name, ignore_missing=False) self.assertEqual(tuple(self.columns), columns) self.assertEqual(list(self.data), list(data))

commit_message:
Migrate "network set" command to use SDK.

This patch makes "network set" command use sdk.

Since we have to keep the other commands runnable with
the old network client, we use a temporary method to
create sdk network client. And as a result, the tests
need to patch a method to fake the temporary method,
which will be removed at last.

Change-Id: I794ac4b82d9200747298f1a9ee44611140e9b6d0
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
Co-Authored-By: Terry Howe <terrylhowe@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Fix the endpoint of /v2 on concept doc

As the folloing content of etc/nova/api-paste.ini, legacy v2
endpoint is /v2, not /v2.1.

 /v1.1: openstack_compute_api_v21_legacy_v2_compatible
 /v2: openstack_compute_api_v21_legacy_v2_compatible
 /v2.1: openstack_compute_api_v21

So this patch fixes the endpoint.

Partially implements blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

Change-Id: I6d9346ced38f522c516778cadae217d1d5c9cff1

subject: tighten regex on objectify
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-08 18:57:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/api_samples_test_base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/eb4ef63ef8dd26ed7a62627762574f57b2cdd9f8', 'message': 'tighten regex on objectify

There are some strange and wonderous work arounds in the json loader
for samples templates to do with templated values which are ints. This
was always kind of a hack, but when attempting to add a replacement
value in the middle of a string it was clear that the anchoring for
this regex was wrong.

Update the begin anchor to be ': ' instead of [^"], which would match
anywhere inside a string.

Change-Id: I9811b34d58a4d4cf7f181689b25212893880dcf4
'}]
commit_message:
tighten regex on objectify

There are some strange and wonderous work arounds in the json loader
for samples templates to do with templated values which are ints. This
was always kind of a hack, but when attempting to add a replacement
value in the middle of a string it was clear that the anchoring for
this regex was wrong.

Update the begin anchor to be ': ' instead of [^"], which would match
anywhere inside a string.

Change-Id: I9811b34d58a4d4cf7f181689b25212893880dcf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/254909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(sdague): templates will contain values like %(foo)s # throughout them. If these are inside of double quoted # strings, life is good, and we can treat it just like valid # json to load it to python. # # However we've got some fields which are ints, like # aggregate_id. This means we've got a snippet in the sample # that looks like: # # "id": %(aggregate_id)s, # # which is not valid json, and will explode. We do a quick and # dirty transform of this to: # # "id": "%(int:aggregate_id)s", # # That makes it valid data to convert to json, but keeps # around the information that we need to drop those strings # later. The regex anchors from the ': ', as all of these will # be top rooted keys. data = re.sub(r'(\: )%\((.+)\)s([^"])', r'\1"%(int:\2)s"\3', data)
deleted_lines: # NOTE(vish): allow non-quoted replacements to survive json data = re.sub(r'([^"])%\((.+)\)s([^"])', r'\1"%(int:\2)s"\3', data)

commit_message:
Migrate "network delete" command to use SDK.

This patch makes "network delete" command use sdk.

Since we have to keep the other commands runnable with
the old network client, we use a temporary method to
create sdk network client. And as a result, the tests
need to patch a method to fake the temporary method,
which will be removed at last.

Change-Id: I1f2c404e4b0ff6727e4c535ce543aa406f2290ce
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
Co-Authored-By: Terry Howe <terrylhowe@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/45/253345/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('openstackclient.network.v2.network._make_client_sdk') # The network to delete. _network = network_fakes.FakeNetwork.create_one_network() self.network.delete_network = mock.Mock(return_value=None) self.network.find_network = mock.Mock(return_value=self._network) def test_delete(self, _make_client_sdk): _make_client_sdk.return_value = self.app.client_manager.network self._network.name, ('networks', [self._network.name]), self.network.delete_network.assert_called_with(self._network)
deleted_lines: self.network.delete_network = mock.Mock( return_value=None ) self.network.list_networks = mock.Mock( return_value={RESOURCES: [copy.deepcopy(RECORD)]} ) def test_delete(self): FAKE_NAME, ('networks', [FAKE_NAME]), self.network.delete_network.assert_called_with(FAKE_ID)

subject: Fix the bug of can't get the desired image info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 17:11:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/709ceadb18490bbc47015ddf1119f9459b38c41f', 'message': 'Improve the imageutils.QemuImgInfo class to parse image info more exactly

The current imageutils.QemuImgInfo class parse all the image info
at first, but if one of the info is unavailable, it would raise a
ValueError.

Sometimes, user only care one of the info which is really
available, but it may be failed because of the ValueError which is
caused by another unavailable info.

commit_message:
Fix the bug of can't get the desired image info

When we use 'qemu-img info' command to get image info, some kinds
of image may show an 'unavailable' disk size. For example:

$qemu-img info sheepdog:volume-1af1afa0-7820-4063-9b90-4fa6161a74a9
image: sheepdog:volume-1af1afa0-7820-4063-9b90-4fa6161a74a9
file format: raw
virtual size: 10G (10737418240 bytes)
disk size: unavailable

$qemu-img info -f rbd rbd:data/foo
image: rbd:data/foo
file format: rbd
virtual size: 10G (10737418240 bytes)
disk size: unavailable
cluster_size: 4194304

The current code didn't consider 'unavailable' size, and it will
raise a ValueError in this case. This patch fixed this bug by
adding the judgment of 'unavailable' size.

Change-Id: Ic5f3b80e172baaafc07432319f8aa24bf117b392
Closes-Bug: #1516083
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/41/245241/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.details = self._parse(cmd_output or '') self.image = self.details.get('image') try: details = self._extract_details(root, root_details, lines) contents[root] = details except ValueError: contents[root] = 'unknow' # The available key should be one of the following: # backing_file, file_format, virtual_size, cluster_size, # disk_size, snapshots, encrypted. def __getattr__(self, key): if key == 'snapshots': value = self.details.get('snapshot_list', []) else: value = self.details.get(key) if value == 'unknow': msg = _("Can't get %s info of image %s!" % (key, self.image)) raise ValueError(msg) return value
deleted_lines: details = self._parse(cmd_output or '') self.image = details.get('image') self.backing_file = details.get('backing_file') self.file_format = details.get('file_format') self.virtual_size = details.get('virtual_size') self.cluster_size = details.get('cluster_size') self.disk_size = details.get('disk_size') self.snapshots = details.get('snapshot_list', []) self.encrypted = details.get('encrypted') details = self._extract_details(root, root_details, lines) contents[root] = details

commit_message:
Migrate "network create" command to use SDK.

This patch makes "network create" command use sdk.

Since we have to keep the other commands runnable with
the old network client, we use a temporary method to
create sdk network client. And as a result, the tests
need to patch a method to fake the temporary method,
which will be removed at last.

Change-Id: I06559c675be1188747257f72f18d6b4d420d0285
Implements: blueprint neutron-client
Co-Authored-By: Terry Howe <terrylhowe@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Try to show policy after policy created

Try to show policy after policy created, like what we do after
profile created, so that we can display created_time.

Closes-Bug: #1522324
Change-Id: I85eb5c7335315fb2f0a10b79ceaa4f228e4d7d2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/54/254254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _show_policy(sc, policy_id=policy.id)

"}]
commit_message:
Cluster's timeout is in seconds not minutes

In the help msg of cluster_create and cluster_update, timeout is
described in minutes, but actually it's in seconds, this patch
fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1523791
Change-Id: I8bb1f1da59aad902f2bb5068dc941f09e17cc638
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/01/254601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help=_('Cluster creation timeout in seconds.')) help=_('New timeout (in seconds) value for the cluster.'))
deleted_lines: help=_('Cluster creation timeout in minutes.')) help=_('New timeout (in minutes) value for the cluster.'))

commit_message:
Distributed DHCP Agents

Distributing the DHCP across compute nodes will
offer better scalability and limit the failure
domain of the IPAM service.

Related-Bug: 1468236

Change-Id: I12d8af4820488880998ffe964d10c649d66ab834
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/29/205429/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Distributed DHCP ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/distributed-dhcp Distributing the DHCP across compute nodes will offer better scalability and limit the failure domain of the IPAM service. Problem Description =================== The existing DHCP agent suffers from several ailments: * When not running HA it has the problem of single point of failure. * When running HA you get redundancy but at a price: * More IPs consumed. * Wasted resources (CPU, Memory). * More network load (Neutron notifications, Guest traffic). Proposed Change =============== By distributing the DHCP agent we stand to gain: * One less agent that needs to run on the network node. * Limit the scope of failure, instead of a SPOF (HA non inclusive) if a compute node fails, only those VMs are affected. * Less traffic on the network: * DHCP related traffic is host only. * RPC traffic would be much more concise (sent only where necessary, message size would be much smaller). * Only necessary dnsmasq processes will be spawned, that is only for the ports served on the specific compute node. * RPC traffic becomes more concise, each agent will get only the exact information it needs. * Due to not runing DHCP agnent, Memory/CPU usage on the network node would be lowered (impact on each compute node will be negligible). * Possibly a way to simplify the DHCP agent related code in the future, as we can get rid of HA, scheduling and other unnecessary stuff. Note: This solution requires Port Binding and DHCP Agent Scheduler extensions (Supported by most, if not all, plugins at the time of drafting this spec). We should enable distributing the DHCP agent and sharing the load. There are several areas that need to be addresed, and are broken down into the following sections: * Scheduling Networks * RPC Communication * IP Address Consumption Scheduling Networks & RPC Communication --------------------------------------- Each compute node will run the DHCP agent, the Neutron controller will be responsible for the scheduling aspects and the RPC communication with the agents: * Each DHCP agent will only receive the information it requires to service its running VMs (both when receiving notifications and when querying for information). * The controller will take care of smart scheduling by 'binding:host_id' which will schedule networks to be serviced by DHCP agents running on the node where the VM instances are running. For illustration, let's say we have 2 tenants each with 2 VMs, the system would ideally look like this:: +---------------------+ | | | Neutron Controller | | | +------+---+---+------+ | | | +------------------+ | +------------------+ | | | Receives info Receives info about Receives info about VM 1 only VM 2 & VM 4 only about VM 3 only | | | | +---------+---------+ | +---------+---------+ | | +---------+---------+ | | | Compute Node B | | | | Compute Node A | | | | Compute Node C | | | | Tenant 1 network: | | | | Tenant 1 network: | | * DHCP (10.1.0.1) | | Tenant 2 network: | | * DHCP (10.1.0.1) | | * VM 2 (10.1.0.3) | | * DHCP (10.2.0.1) | | * VM 1 (10.1.0.2) | | | | * VM 3 (10.2.0.2) | | | | Tenant 2 network: | | | +-------------------+ | * DHCP (10.2.0.1) | +-------------------+ | * VM 4 (10.2.0.3) | | | +-------------------+ You may notice that on compute node A only VM 1 is running (in fact it's the VM's port that is bound to that node). This means that: * Updates regarding VM 1's port will go only to that compute node. * When the DHCP agent on that node will query the controller it will receive only information regarding VM 1's port. Note: Special care needs to be taken on port migration, the old agent should know that it's not servicing the port anymore. In this case, the controller will send a "port delete" notification to the old agent. IP Address Consumption ---------------------- Ideally each subnet will have a single IP address for the DHCP server (as illustrated). This however imposes some limitations (some of which might be desirable): * No HA for DHCP agents is possible (more prone to certain race conditions). * DHCP IP can't be reached from outside the cloud. * Admin will just see a single port per subnet in Neutron, without granularity of each host's binding. * This solution will be tied initially only to the ML2 OVS mechanism driver, each other driver or 3rd party plugin will have to support it individually in some way. Since the support is on the agent level, it could be possible to have a deployment where the DHCP agent is actually consuming an IP per host it's serving (given smart scheduling this will usually be less than the number of hosts in the deployment). The OVS agent would need to be changed to support a "distributed DHCP port", much like it's supporting DVR. To make DHCP related traffic host only, it support includes: * Preventing any traffic generated by the DHCP server from leaving the host. * Preventing any DHCP destined traffic (oiriginating from instaces) from leaving the host, this includes: * ARP requests for the DHCP agent. * Neighbor Solicitation requests (if IPv6 is to be supported). * DHCP requests (both IPv4 and IPv6 types). * This should probably be implemented using flows on br-tun/br-xx. The following diagram explains the necessary decisions:: Is originating from DHCP port? / \ / \ No Yes / \ / \ Is Is dest. unicast? a local / \ port? / \ / \ No Yes / \ / \ No Yes / \ / \ Is it an info Proceed / \ request for with Drop Pass to the DHCP port normal the local (ARP or NS)? handling port / \ / \ No Yes / \ / \ Proceed Pass to with the DHCP normal port only handling Data Model Impact ----------------- It should add a new table 'dhcp_port_bindings' to record the DHCP port bind to which host. REST API Impact --------------- None. Security Impact --------------- Compute nodes will now need to run the DHCP agent which requires sudo access to several programs, already specified by *etc/neutron/rootwrap.d/dhcp.filters* Notifications Impact -------------------- Port notifications for DHCP agents will be sent only to the host where the port is bound. Other End User Impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ There will be several performance impacts: * At the host level, each served network would have a dnsmasq process and a DHCP agent. This would have some impact which is estimated to be minor in a system of sufficient resources. * Increased memory consumption: * Each dnsmasq process takes up about 2MB. * The DHCP agent takes up about 40Mb. * Increased CPU consumption (Should be negligble as we don't expect heavy load on a single host basis). * The network node(s) will not be running the DHCP service nor any dnsmasq instances so it should free up memory & CPU there (Impact should be maningful in systems with large scale). * RPC messages will be trimmed down to contain only the necessary info, so less network traffic and less processing power will be used to handle these messages. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- When deploying distributed IPAM, Each compute node will now run a DHCP agent. Deployment would now look like this:: +---------------------+ | | | Neutron Controller | | | | * API Server | | * Plugin | | * Agent Sched. Ext. | | * Port Binding Ext. | | | +---------------------+ +-------------------+ +-------------------+ +-------------------+ | | | | | | | Compute Node A | | Compute Node B | | Compute Node C | | | | | | | | * Compute Agent | | * Compute Agent | | * Compute Agent | | * L2 Agent (opt.) | | * L2 Agent (opt.) | | * L2 Agent (opt.) | | * DHCP Agent | | * DHCP Agent | | * DHCP Agent | | | | | | | +-------------------+ +-------------------+ +-------------------+ The following configuration options will be added: * To the neutron.conf file: * The option **distributed_dhcp_agent** (default False). This determines whether the DHCP agent is expected to be on each node or not. * When set to **True** the controller will use smart scheduling of networks and communicate only the required information to each agent (via RPC). * When set to **False** the controller will work with all existing DHCP agent features (HA, network scheduling, etc) and communicate all information to agents as required (based on the network scheduling). * To the OVS agent conf file: * The option **distributed_dhcp_port** (default False). This determines whether the agent should use a single IP per DHCP port (with the port present on each serviced node) or a unique IP. * When set to **True** the OVS agent will set the same IP address to the DHCP port of the network (i.e. the DHCP port on tenant's network will have the same IP address on all the hosts servicing that network). * When set to **False** then each DHCP agent will consume a unique IP for each network that it's servicing. The following table illustrates the expected behavior with regards to the new configuration options (names shortened for better readability):: +=================+================+=======================================+ | dist_dhcp_agent | dist_dhcp_port | End result | | (on controller) | (on all nodes) | | +=================+================+=======================================+ | False | False | No change - same as today, DHCP | | | | agent needs to run on a network node. | +-----------------+----------------+---------------------------------------+ | False | True | Invalid configuration. | | | | (Unexpected behavior!) | +-----------------+----------------+---------------------------------------+ | True | False | DHCP agent runs on each compute node. | | | | **Benefit:** Can work with all | | | | plugins (that support the required | | | | extensions). | | | | **Drawback:** IP is consumed for | | | | each DHCP server servicing a network | | | | on a node. | +-----------------+----------------+---------------------------------------+ | True | True | DHCP agent runs on each compute node. | | | | **Benefit:** Only one IP is consumed | | | | for each network. | | | | **Drawback:** Can work only with | | | | supporting plugins (initially ML2 + | | | | OVS). | +-----------------+----------------+---------------------------------------+ In order to use this feature in a new or existing deployment, the cloud deployer would need to first install the DHCP service on each compute node and then turn on the required configuration options, according to the table above. Developer Impact ---------------- None. Community Impact ---------------- We plan to bring this change up at the Kilo summit, it has been listed as a topic to discuss in the Neutron IPAM talks. Alternatives ------------ Per host IPAM could be incorporated as part of the OVS agent, much like the ARP responder mechanism. This could alleviate the need for a DHCP agent/servers entirely, however there are a few major cons to this: * The current DHCP agent provides many features, more than IPAM alone. It would be better to reuse the tried and tested code than re-implement it in OVS using openflow rules. * It would be entirely focused on the OVS agent and not applicable to any other connectivity technology without a rewrite, whereas the proposed solution would wither just work for any plugin, or require a much smaller support (distributed port). Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: mkolesni Other contributors: amuller Work Items ---------- The feature consists of the following tasks: * Enable distributed IPAM - adding the configuration value in the controller and modifying RPC communications to be agent specific. At this point "stupid" scheduling can be used so that all networks are scheduled to all the agents in case the IPAM is distributed. * Smart network scheduling - adding a scheduler class that takes into consideration which agent is serving which network based on the ports bound to the hosts. Additional infrastructural support might be necessary to unschedule networks from hosts no longer serving them. * Distributed DHCP ports - adding the configuration value in the OVS agent and code for the distributed port to work. This work might rely on previous work to add a distributed ports mechanism if such will be available or planned. Dependencies ============ None currently. If a blueprint for a generic mechanism for distributed ports will be available, this spec should rely on it. Testing ======= Since Tempest has no support for multi node testing, the tests would need to be done using the upcoming Integration testing framework. The following tests are described in a high level, lacking menial details e.g. network creation. Tempest Tests ------------- None. Integration Tests ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ We need some multi node support, it can be materialized on the same host or on several hosts. The following integration tests would need to be added: * Test default behavior (AIO): * Start Neutron controller with: distributed_dhcp_agent = False * Start an agent. * Create some ports bound to a host. * Check that the DHCP agent has scheduled the ports to be served. * Test distributed agents (3 "nodes" required): * Start Neutron controller with: distributed_dhcp_agent = True * Start 2 DHCP agents on 2 nodes. * Create some ports bound to the first node and some to the second. * Check that the ports are serviced only on their respective nodes, i.e. the lease file on each node should contain only the allocations for ports that are bound to that node. Functional Tests ---------------- The following tests will be added: * Test multiple DHCP ports: * Start the DHCP agent with distributed_dhcp_port = False * Create a port to be serviced by the agent. * Check that OVS has no limitations for DHCP traffic. * Test single DHCP port: * Start the DHCP agent with distributed_dhcp_port = True * Create a port to be serviced by the agent. * Check that OVS is limiting the DHCP port's traffic from exiting the node. * Check that OVS is limiting DHCP requests from exiting the node. API Tests --------- None. Documentation Impact ==================== What is the impact on the docs team of this change? Some changes might require donating resources to the docs team to have the documentation updated. Don't repeat details discussed above, but please reference them here. User Documentation ------------------ * The Networking part of the Admin Guide would need to have a section describing the way to deploy the distributed DHCP service. * The guides for the configuration files should be updated with the new options. Developer Documentation ----------------------- None. References ========== None.

commit_message:
Make add_router_to_l3_agent use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes add_router_to_l3_agent of network client
to use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I2f17062076a3a356bbb2f67099bcc9b3edd2f76f

commit_message:
Add documentation for network RBAC feature

This adds some documentation for the new policy engine
added to Neutron and its initial use case of sharing
Neutron networks with specific tenants.

commit_message:
Bumps os-win version to 0.0.7

os-win 0.0.7 has been released. Some of the changes are:

Adds method for checking if disk is attached.
Adds Python 3 compatibility.
Adds exception and unused arguments cleanup.
Adds virtual disk IOPS limits setter.
Caches Windows version. The  HyperVDriver will load faster.
Adds method to set VM boot order.

Change-Id: Id742202cd2c412e5e8c84951b6215206b25c18ee

commit_message:
Remove invalid comment about LDAP domain support

LDAP does not and will not support domain CRUD.

There is a test in test_backend_ldap.py checking
that domain CRUD is returns 403 Forbidden.

This patches removes a comment that said that
test should be removed once domain CRUD is
supported by LDAP; which is invalid.

Change-Id: I359790025cc412ef87d406fd07dc8cd60afe07d2

commit_message:
Pull project out of request in addition to tenant

Keystone V3 renamed tenant to project. In order to deal with keystone
V3, start pulling X-Project-Id from the headers.

Since keystonemiddleware authtoken sets both X-Project-* and
X-Tenant-*, we don't need to look up X-Tenant-*.

Don't do anything with renaming the internal variables - that will come
later.

Change-Id: I5e27cf6a54fb603b81d41b8b4f085d59354627fb
Depends-On: I1f754a9a949ef92f4e427a91bbd1b1e73e86c8c4
Closes-Bug: #1503428

commit_message:
Make param description & LogInfo better

*Replace 'the execution of a benchmark scenario' with 'the task
 execution' in Line 265.
 Since 1) we do not widely use term `benchmark';
       2) actually the whole task is being stopped, not only
          specific scenario.
*Some param's descreption not unified.

Change-Id: Iabc0718002c1d14cb3f8da9a99ad9991c967a833

commit_message:
Rename get_db_flavor_details to show_db_flavor_details

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to flavors client

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I3a1ad587af43f5177b9d7d95a3c2170a4b1224c0

commit_message:
Reset the compute_rpcapi in Compute manager on SIGHUP

This links Service.reset() to the manager, which for compute will
rebuild the compute_rpcapi and thus re-determine the appropriate
RPC versions.

Change-Id: Ifec7f6ff604d1e5f3663633065e9a55baacffec8

commit_message:
Initial patch for Trircle stateless architecture

Initial patch to implement the framework of Tricircle, this is
the part for Nova api gateway and Cinder api gateway, keystone
authentication integrated.

Change-Id: I7e33948d4850cf1eabeb9c865fc79c2475323988
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/implement-stateless
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/79/254479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Huawei Tech. Co., Ltd. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import pecan import oslo_log.log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class RootController(object): @pecan.expose() def _lookup(self, version, *remainder): if version == 'v2': return V2Controller(), remainder @pecan.expose(generic=True, template='json') def index(self): return { "versions": [ { "status": "CURRENT", "updated": "2012-11-21T11:33:21Z", "id": "v2.0", "links": [ { "href": pecan.request.application_url + "/v2/", "rel": "self" } ] } ] } @index.when(method='POST') @index.when(method='PUT') @index.when(method='DELETE') @index.when(method='HEAD') @index.when(method='PATCH') def not_supported(self): pecan.abort(405) class V2Controller(object): _media_type1 = "application/vnd.openstack.volume+xml;version=1" _media_type2 = "application/vnd.openstack.volume+json;version=1" def __init__(self): self.sub_controllers = { } for name, ctrl in self.sub_controllers.items(): setattr(self, name, ctrl) @pecan.expose(generic=True, template='json') def index(self): return { "version": { "status": "CURRENT", "updated": "2012-11-21T11:33:21Z", "media-types": [ { "base": "application/xml", "type": self._media_type1 }, { "base": "application/json", "type": self._media_type2 } ], "id": "v2.0", "links": [ { "href": pecan.request.application_url + "/v2/", "rel": "self" }, { "href": "http://docs.openstack.org/", "type": "text/html", "rel": "describedby" } ] } } @index.when(method='POST') @index.when(method='PUT') @index.when(method='DELETE') @index.when(method='HEAD') @index.when(method='PATCH') def not_supported(self): pecan.abort(405)

subject: Load the 8021q kernel module in simple-init
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 20:41:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/0667c51c08bc370c6d3d33bdebf0e7dadb9e7535', 'message': 'Load the 8021q kernel module in simple-init

Vlan support was recently added to glean. However, if the 8021q module
is not loaded, glean will fail to bring up a tagged interfaced defined
in /etc/network/interfaces.d/. Manually attempting to bring up the
interface results in an error[1]. This patch ensures that the 8021q
module is loaded so that tagged interfaces can be brought up at boot.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/480027/

commit_message:
Load the 8021q kernel module in simple-init

Vlan support was recently added to glean. However, if the 8021q module
is not loaded, glean will fail to bring up a tagged interfaced defined
in /etc/network/interfaces.d/. Manually attempting to bring up the
interface results in an error[1]. This patch ensures that the 8021q
module is loaded so that tagged interfaces can be brought up at boot.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/480027/

Change-Id: I15d805c07d4b5e1161d831f0393d027e4325137f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/12/250012/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Load the 8021q module so glean can support tagged interfaces modprobe 8021q

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This patch fixes this problem.
See:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/189569
Closes-Bug: #1465086
Change-Id: Iafd49c8f9c11561dd85820367eaf2cb6b19a7aeb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/41/252241/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: passenv = http_proxy HTTP_PROXY https_proxy HTTPS_PROXY no_proxy NO_PROXY

commit_message:
Help msg about libvirt always default device names

Supplying a device name for any of the block devices specified as part
of the `nova boot` or `nova volume-attach` call will not be honoured by
any libvirt compute nodes.
We should modify documentation make this more clear.

Change-Id: I3209c2829225492df25ff9ab9098071372957bd5
Closes-Bug: 1479214

commit_message:
[V3] Rename get_region to show_region

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to region client

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I5fc446b2e5f8931a1a8b27b0db03956a0e3ad8b2

commit_message:
Fix grub-efi-amd64-signed install failure

When build ubuntu iso image, it will install grub-efi-amd64-signed
and grub-efi-amd64 packages. Both of the postinst script will try
to find root device and install grub which will definitely fail in
such a chroot environment.
So the workaround is to skip error and remove postinst script.
And confirm the package be installed successfully at last.

Change-Id: Ie0aecb212b22362046db55b5ad8c64c3211c28e5
Closes-Bug: #1491280
Co-Authored-By: Jane.zhang <jian.zhang8@hpe.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/12/219612/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # grub-efi-amd64-signed of ubuntu will try to call grub-ef-amd64 to install grub into # root device which definitely fail at this stage # the workaround is to skip error and remove postinst script if [[ "ubuntu" =~ "$DISTRO_NAME" ]]; then set +e package-installs-v2 --phase install.d /tmp/package-installs.json if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then GRUB_EFI_AMD64_SIGNED_POSTINST=/var/lib/dpkg/info/grub-efi-amd64-signed.postinst GRUB_EFI_AMD64_POSTINST=/var/lib/dpkg/info/grub-efi-amd64.postinst if [ -e $GRUB_EFI_AMD64_SIGNED_POSTINST -o -e $GRUB_EFI_AMD64_POSTINST ]; then rm -f $GRUB_EFI_AMD64_SIGNED_POSTINST $GRUB_EFI_AMD64_POSTINST else set -e && false fi fi set -e else package-installs-v2 --phase install.d /tmp/package-installs.json fi

commit_message:
Fix mocking in several tests causing excessive run-times

Several tests have missing mocking resulting in many minutes wasted
waiting for either RPC or client validation to time out.

Strangely this doesn't cause the tests to fail, only waste a lot of
time (tox -e py27 was taking over 10 mins for me, now nearer 5)

There are more broken tests to fix, but some have logical errors
so will be handled via subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I2021505930d6547a16531de6b2f9fbf33855fa3a
Partial-Bug: #1524047

commit_message:
Fix dictionary key error

The key 'multipath' was being referenced in the 'connector' dictionary
in initialize_connection(), even though the key was not always set.

Change-Id: Ia3c7640a24ebe9bedec3402f6cefb7e457c66ecd
Closes-Bug: #1522062

commit_message:
Avoid service_instance neutron port clash in HA

Currently, after getting the list of ports from neutron,
we filter based on the device_id. In HA, two nodes will
share the same device_id. Hence, ports on different HA
backends are reported together causing a
ServiceInstanceException, not allowing for port creation
on the required backend.
This patch will use both device_id and binding:host_id
properties to filter neutron port lists to check for
valid port clashes if any.

Closes-Bug: #1519326
Change-Id: I81a16c360b1e8fffccddef5f358136e5fbde81e4

commit_message:
Remove the Metric proxy

This proxy class is not currently useful in any usable way so it just
pollutes the namespace of loaded proxy classes. It was added
to get the class started, but was not completed. Rather than offer a
proxy that only tells you what it can do but can't do anything, it's
removed. The resources that would populate a proxy class are left alone.

Change-Id: I30dbff0dbba26633d3b02ee5f0751b4224cef8f4

commit_message:
Add optional argument to list subcommand

Cinder list command was intended to show summary of
volumes, but currently the command shows many entries
than we expected.

This patch adds these two fixes to show volume list
more simply.

- Remove 'migration status' and 'multiattach' from
  default list view.

- Add '--field' optional argument to 'list' subcommand.
  This argument allows users to show only specified
  entries. Unavailable fields will be ignored from
  the list result.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Iad4bf76e87f84b6e57ec59d134b9413fcad16ce8
Closes-Bug: #1502639

commit_message:
Move Detail page styling into theme

This patch creates a breadcrumb header component and moves the detail
styling into the theme. This should make it easier for themes to
override.

- Alter the breadcrumb header padding, so that everything is aligned correctly
  after the bootstrap tabs patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246004/
- Add a small margin under tabs, to account for both details and
  workflows; remove the previous workflows-only padding.

Change-Id: I11034d30de900eda50bbc92c275194b6ec731c0d
Closes-Bug: 1516021

commit_message:
Fix the bug of "Error spelling of 'explicitely'"

The word "explicitely" should be spelled as "explicitly".
So it is changed.

(df) Ran spell-check on entire file and fixed a few more
misspellings.

Change-Id: I25d2accc2e0a1aaff71011944a62dadceb508b47
Closes-Bug: #1501202

commit_message:
Add port option support for ipmitool

This adds support for ipmitools port (-p) option allowing operators
to run ipmi on non-default ports.

Change-Id: I9203c2db01cc46a183901c454e98426b4583ce08
closes-bug: #1523577
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/99/254899/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add support for ipmitool's port (-p) option. This allows ipmitool support for operators that do not use the default port (623) as there ipmi port.

commit_message:
Add support for glance task import

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Glance-tasks-import
Added API for task create, delete and list
Added task image exception
Added wait_for_image for v2
Added wait_for_image_task v2
Added a testcase.
testcase description:
- creating a task for imported dummy image via http
- converting the disk_format for the image
- wait till new created image will be in ready status
- verify image disk_format and task status and type
I am planning to commit more tests for different disk formats.

Change-Id: If4fedc318359603767bc9ec49af572feade7f4bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/92/251092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.image import base from tempest.common import waiters from tempest import config from tempest import test from tempest_lib.common.utils import data_utils CONF = config.CONF class ImagesTasksTest(base.BaseV2ImageTest): @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(ImagesTasksTest, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.image_feature_enabled.task_import_image: msg = "%s task-import-image is not available" % cls.__name__ raise cls.skipException(msg) @test.idempotent_id('52b64e40-e34e-4a00-a31c-b48c986c0205') def test_import_from_qcow2_to_raw_format_image(self): action_type = "import" import_format = "qcow2" # a dummy image, import_from supports http import_image_url = CONF.image.http_image image_name = data_utils.rand_name('image') container_format = "bare" disk_format = "raw" data = dict(type=action_type, input={ "image_properties": {"name": image_name, "container_format": container_format, "disk_format": disk_format}, "import_from_format": import_format, "import_from": import_image_url}) body = self.client.create_task(data) task_id = body['id'] waiters.wait_for_image_task_status(self.client, task_id, "success") # check task status - in success state. body_task = self.client.show_task(task_id) self.assertEqual(action_type, body_task['type']) params = {'name': image_name} images = self.client.list_images(params)['images'] self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_image, images[0]['id']) # calling to a wait for glance v2 waiters.wait_for_image_status(self.client, images[0]['id'], 'active') self.assertEqual(image_name, images[0]['name']) self.assertEqual(disk_format, images[0]['disk_format']) self.assertEqual(container_format, images[0]['container_format'])

added_lines: class TranslatorShell(object): SUPPORTED_TYPES = ['tosca'] def _validate(self, args): if len(args) < 2: msg = _("The program requires minimum two arguments. " "Please refer to the usage documentation.") raise ValueError(msg) if "--template-file=" not in args[0]: msg = _("The program expects --template-file as first argument. " "Please refer to the usage documentation.") raise ValueError(msg) if "--template-type=" not in args[1]: msg = _("The program expects --template-type as second argument. " "Please refer to the usage documentation.") raise ValueError(msg) def main(self, args): self._validate(args) path = args[0].split('--template-file=')[1] # e.g. --template_file=translator/tests/data/tosca_helloworld.yaml template_type = args[1].split('--template-type=')[1] # e.g. --template_type=tosca if not template_type: raise ValueError(_("Template type is needed. For example, 'tosca'")) elif template_type not in self.SUPPORTED_TYPES: raise ValueError(_("%(value)s is not a valid template type.") % {'value': template_type}) parsed_params = {} if len(args) > 2: parsed_params = self._parse_parameters(args[2]) a_file = os.path.isfile(path) a_url = UrlUtils.validate_url(path) if not a_file else False if a_file or a_url: heat_tpl = self._translate(template_type, path, parsed_params, a_file) if heat_tpl: self._write_output(heat_tpl) else: raise ValueError(_("The path %(path)s is not a valid file or URL.") % {'path': path}) def _parse_parameters(self, parameter_list): parsed_inputs = {} if parameter_list.startswith('--parameters'): # Parameters are semi-colon separated inputs = parameter_list.split('--parameters=')[1].\ replace('"', '').split(';') # Each parameter should be an assignment for param in inputs: keyvalue = param.split('=') # Validate the parameter has both a name and value if keyvalue.__len__() is 2: # Assure parameter name is not zero-length or whitespace stripped_name = keyvalue[0].strip() if not stripped_name: raise ValueError(_("'%(param)s' is not a well-formed " "parameter.") % {'param': param}) # Add the valid parameter to the dictionary parsed_inputs[keyvalue[0]] = keyvalue[1] else: else: raise ValueError(_("'%(list)s' is not a valid parameter list.") % {'list': parameter_list}) return parsed_inputs def _translate(self, sourcetype, path, parsed_params, a_file): output = None if sourcetype == "tosca": tosca = ToscaTemplate(path, parsed_params, a_file) translator = TOSCATranslator(tosca, parsed_params) output = translator.translate() return output def _write_output(self, output): print(output) def main(args=None): if args is None: args = sys.argv[1:] TranslatorShell().main(args)

" "Please refer to the usage documentation.") raise ValueError(msg) if "--template-file=" not in sys.argv[1]: msg = _("The program expects --template-file as first argument. " "Please refer to the usage documentation.") raise ValueError(msg) if "--template-type=" not in sys.argv[2]: msg = _("The program expects --template-type as second argument. " "Please refer to the usage documentation.") raise ValueError(msg) path = sys.argv[1].split('--template-file=')[1] # e.g. --template_file=translator/tests/data/tosca_helloworld.yaml template_type = sys.argv[2].split('--template-type=')[1] # e.g. --template_type=tosca supported_types = ['tosca'] if not template_type: raise ValueError(_("Template type is needed. For example, 'tosca'")) elif template_type not in supported_types: raise ValueError(_("%(value)s is not a valid template type.") % {'value': template_type}) parsed_params = {} if len(sys.argv) > 3: parsed_params = parse_parameters(sys.argv[3]) a_file = os.path.isfile(path) a_url = UrlUtils.validate_url(path) if not a_file else False if a_file or a_url: heat_tpl = translate(template_type, path, parsed_params, a_file) if heat_tpl: write_output(heat_tpl) else: raise ValueError(_("The path %(path)s is not a valid file or URL.") % {'path': path}) def parse_parameters(parameter_list): parsed_inputs = {} if parameter_list.startswith('--parameters'): # Parameters are semi-colon separated inputs = parameter_list.split('--parameters=')[1].\ replace('"', '').split(';') # Each parameter should be an assignment for param in inputs: keyvalue = param.split('=') # Validate the parameter has both a name and value if keyvalue.__len__() is 2: # Assure parameter name is not zero-length or whitespace stripped_name = keyvalue[0].strip() if not stripped_name: # Add the valid parameter to the dictionary parsed_inputs[keyvalue[0]] = keyvalue[1] else: raise ValueError(_("'%(param)s' is not a well-formed " "parameter.") % {'param': param}) else: raise ValueError(_("'%(list)s' is not a valid parameter list.") % {'list': parameter_list}) return parsed_inputs def translate(sourcetype, path, parsed_params, a_file): output = None if sourcetype == "tosca": tosca = ToscaTemplate(path, parsed_params, a_file) translator = TOSCATranslator(tosca, parsed_params) output = translator.translate() return output def write_output(output): print(output)

commit_message:
Adds nosec to system call in NetcatSocket._terminate

This patch adds "# nosec" comment to os.system call in the
NetcatSocket._terminate function to avoid having it be reported
during the gate test as the call is identified as safe.

commit_message:
Consider 'in-use' a non-pending volume for caching

We don't cache volume list if one of the volumes is in pending state, as
otherwise we'd miss the cloud-side cache invalidation. However, active
volumes that are attached are in state "in-use" - so basically if you
had one active volume, the cache would never cache.

Change-Id: I03cbc1b814e4a5829936a22751ee81d52b83fb2e

commit_message:
Allow 'is_public' to be set on protected resources

Since *is_public* is meta-information on all objects rather
than content, sahara should allow it to be changed even if *is_protected*
is True. This will make it simpler for users to share protected
objects.

Change-Id: I016bec5282787dba37071af70b16a89764658137
Partial-implements: blueprint allow-public-on-protected
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-specs refs/changes/07/246007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== Allow 'is_public' to be set on protected resources ================================================== Since *is_public* is meta-information on all objects rather than content, sahara should allow it to be changed even if *is_protected* is True. This will make it simpler for users to share protected objects. https://blueprints.launchpad.net/sahara/+spec/allow-public-on-protected Problem description =================== Currently checks on *is_protected* prevent any field in an object from being modified. This guarantees that the content of the object will not be changed accidentally. However, *is_public* is an access control flag and does not really pertain to object content. In order to share a protected object, a user must currently set *is_protected* to False while making the change to *is_public*, and then perform another operation to set the *is_protected* flag back to True. Proposed change =============== As a convenience, allow *is_public* to be modified even if *is_protected* is True. The *is_public* field will be the only exception to the normal checks. Alternatives ------------ Leave it unchanged Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Sahara-image-elements impact ---------------------------- None Sahara-dashboard / Horizon impact --------------------------------- This may require a Horizon change (croberts please comment) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: tmckay Other contributors: croberts Work Items ---------- Modify *is_protected* checks in the sahara engine Modify unit tests Horizon changes Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests Documentation Impact ==================== None, unless there is a current section discussing protected/public References ========== None

commit_message:
[V3] Rename get_credential to show_credential

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to credentials client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I07c4403e42d6f2c7617f455a8a4f292ff10e7059

commit_message:
Remove excessive quotes in _revert_resize()

When refactoring wait_for(), the status variable was accidentally
quoted, which prevented reverting a resize from working. This fixes
that and adds tests to ensure that it stays fixed.

Change-Id: Iba15c6cc07f190a073ed0e785973987b10e499c8

commit_message:
Fix live migration, updating the method checking job results

The method checking job results has been moved to jobutils, while
in livemigrationutils, it's still called from vmutils.

This patch fixes the issue by using the right method.

Change-Id: I8262cd7b44166d106600056637af819e93513ed2

Python 3: Use oslo_serialization.jsonutils.loads instead of json.loads

The former always returns the proper type.

This patch fixes:

cinder.tests.unit.api.contrib.test_volume_host_attribute
cinder.tests.unit.api.contrib.test_volume_migration_status_attribute
cinder.tests.unit.api.contrib.test_volume_tenant_attribute

Change-Id: I2655f9a8f44b24a21ac554849500babf889dc198
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3

commit_message:
Make the db migration scripts complete

The current db migration scripts cannot reflect the db model we used.
This patch adds migration scripts for service related db and
some alterations on device and device attribute tables.

Change-Id: I3a44c05280c4fa0b6bdb9737ec32200d641f2ac0
Closes-bug: 1518072

commit_message:
Only deploy .my.cnf file on galera/utility containers

The original bug was opened because .my.cnf (with sensitive root credentials)
was being deployed on compute hosts without needing to be there. This patch
restricts the deployment of .my.cnf files to the galera/utility containers
only. This improves security while still allowing deployers to diagnose galera
server issues on the galera server containers themselves, and to access the
database from the utility containers for diagnostic purposes.

Closes-bug: 1510596
Implements: blueprint limit-mysql-config-distribution
Change-Id: I42f39cbfcb02b97846894592d642ac0c58a82b02
(cherry picked from commit e0d58a99debd017ec063b71f290c373892f8b0a3)

commit_message:
Remove grenade-neutron-sideways job

This job was never used for its intended purpose and now there doesn't
seem to be much interest in having an automated, tested upgrade from
nova net to neutron. Since this isn't useful just remove it.

Change-Id: I55715461cb1691336352a364a5dad07c83b50fd0

commit_message:
Update requirements to suit the existence of lxc vg

If lxc volume group exists, the aio will try to use
this volume group to create the containers.

As one container will use a hard 5GB of storage, and
the fact that (by default) there is more than 16
containers, you'll exhaust all your storage space
and the aio build will fail.

This commit should make this failure more clear to
openstack-ansible users.

The amount of disk is counted with the default
install.

Change-Id: I84f68a24423f9e7046b1235ef51bf2291708fcec
(cherry picked from commit dfc544fed974c81d7542ff8167d6a4143914c79c)

Improve log messages from scheduler

Ensure that an unbound method is never logged as "<method name> from None".

Also report the actual action name when doing stack_action().

commit_message:
Bump rackspace-monitoring-cli version

The current version (v0.6.8) has some issues that mean if the raxmon-cli
fails out it doesn't return the appropriate error code.

This patch bumps the version to v0.6.10 which has a fix included for
this bug.

Change-Id: Icb20df78e1e80282b557cbd3d239199771cdb820
Closes-Bug: #1523610

Looks like import CephHA test class directly leads to

commit_message:
Additional Role for Designate Deployment

Change-Id: I57922f84af5c941d4e99f9cb916643f62e205aac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/61/254161/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Designate deployment using openstack-ansible playbooks ###################################################### :date: 2015-12-07 16:30 :tags: designate,openstack-ansible The purpose of this spec is to add support for the OpenStack Designate program to OpenStack Ansible, allowing the deployment of Designate along with the core openstack components using ansible-playbooks. Blueprint - Designate deployment on openstack-ansible: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+spec/designate-for-openstack-ansible Problem description =================== Presently, while deploying openstack on ansible-playbooks only the core openstack components get deployed. The deployment of other components eg, designate,trove on playbooks is not supported yet. To use other component's services, one requires to understand the whole playbook architecture along with openstack deployment and then deploy the component manually. Proposed change =============== The Designate program encompasses a number of projects, but this spec and this proposed series of changes covers the initial implementation of support for Designate. This will involve adding support for the Designate server[1] and Designate client[2]. The proposed changes include: * Creation of an openstack-ansible-designate repository and ansible role to support the deployment of Designate. * Tests to verify the new ansible role. Alternatives ------------ None Playbook/Role impact -------------------- Test playbooks will be placed in the openstack-ansible-designate repository for functional testing purposes, with no initially proposed changes to openstack-ansible playbooks. In the future, once the desigante role is found to be useful and acceptable, a future spec will address the integration of the designate role with the main openstack-ansible repository. Upgrade impact -------------- None Security impact --------------- None. Performance impact ------------------ None. End user impact --------------- Deployers will be able to deploy designate and use DNSaaS through openstack-ansible. Deployer impact --------------- Designate specific configuration options will be added to the new repository. When support for the new Designate role is added to the parent repository, new config options will be made available. However it is expected that Designate support will initially be disabled, requiring that deployers explicitly enable Designate support, and to enroll hosts for openstack-ansible to use. Developer impact ---------------- As this change is self-contained initially, no impact on other developers is expected. Dependencies ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Swati Sharma ( IRC: Swati) Other contributors: None Work items ---------- #. Ask for the new repository, openstack-ansible-desigante, to be created #. Create the role for desigante support * Add support for running designate-api, designate-cental, designate-pool_manager, designate-sink, designate-mdns * Add support for including python-designateclient, which is the operator tool for supporting Designate. Testing ======= Testing has to be done. Develop a test playbook to deploy to hardware that can exercise the new role. Develop tests that verify the roles behaviour independent of actually requiring hardware to test the roles functionality. Documentation impact ==================== Adding support to the user guide on how to enable Designate support will be required. References ========== * [1] The Designate server: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/designate/ * [2] The Designate client: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-designateclient/

commit_message:
Add ability to deploy Murano CloudFoundry Service Broker API

Since Murano has new service CloudFoundry Service Broker API we need
to have an ability to deploy it in MOS 8.0

Implements: bp implement-support-for-murano-service-broker
Change-Id: I338477269a73cb342115511b99bd004c37a43512

commit_message:
Python3 readiness for congress (misc changes)

Changes:
- Explicit conversion of dict view objects to lists for comparison with list
- Explicit copy of dict for iteration while changing dict

Result:
- all congress/tests/* tests pass under tox -epy34.
- py34 gating vote may be enabled along with this patch, to prevent regression
- bugs likely remain which are not caught by unit tests

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3

Change-Id: I4927f4875e8f86464b3c9fc7c63f918945cc359e

commit_message:
Convert instance_flavor configs from IntOpt to StrOpt

Nova instances are not limited to integer IDs and this is required
to support instance flavors with UUIDs or str IDs.

Closes-bug: #1515000
Change-Id: I1abf665f43cb33c1d1d2bd612aed750cae3455a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/astara refs/changes/20/243820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Refactor: Remove use of self where not needed

In test_v3_resource, some tests create local
entities scoped to the test class instance, as
opposed to scoped only to the test method.

This patch fixes such occurrences.

Change-Id: Ie4f1e2e61d89fa10a99c9bebd2b9bd06fccd7c6a

commit_message:
Revert "Move netifaces to extras"

For now revert this, at a later date we can reapply
this but we need to order this a little differently to
make it work out.

This reverts commit 2abbe1c3b19490f570c29502cd56ec92daf4ca45.

Change-Id: I20f3c5804caf1af698aa0f6397a9953eb9aba829

commit_message:
Refactor: Move uncommon entities from setUp

In test_v3_resource, a group and a credential
entities are created but only used by 2 methods.

This patch moves those entities from the setUp
method to the specific tests which need them.

Change-Id: Ib73cea79f2b0f4315022049a78c6b77550ea697a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/92/252692/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The sample data set up already has a user and project that is part of self.domain. Additionally we will create a group and a credential within it. Since the user we will authenticate with is in this domain, we create a another set of entities in a second domain. Deleting this r = self.identity_api.get_group(self.group['id']) self.assertDictEqual(self.group, r) r = self.credential_api.get_credential(self.credential['id']) self.assertDictEqual(self.credential, r) r = self.credential_api.get_credential(self.credential['id']) self.assertDictEqual(self.credential, r) credential_id=self.credential['id'])

commit_message:
Add review guideline to microversion API

Python-novaclient need to be updated to address new microversion
API change , so add some suggestions in the doc.

Change-Id: Ibb2d137a6a16badea7c2619d210317b7a098ec4e

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary extra instance saves during resize

In different resize operations (prep/finish/confirm/revert), flavor
settings are updated to keep track of current/old/new flavor for an
instance. Helper methods in the Instance object that used to assist
with on-the-fly conversion of flavor info from its old storage location
in system metadata to instance extra are used. This conversion is no
longer necessary and calling these helpers cause a large number of
extra saves to happen for no good reason.

This change makes sure no extra saves are done by reworking the code
to eliminate the use of helpers set_flavor() and delete_flavor().

Change-Id: Iaf5379089796f82289602c471608db38b3052904

commit_message:
Catch FixedIpNotFoundForAddress when create server

FixedIpNotFoundForAddress is not catched during server creation,
so 500 error is reported to client side.

Change-Id: I3cd45cd63c962225d6a893ad0fdeb01ecb94e784
Closes-Bug: 1522349

commit_message:
Don't emit confusing error in netns-cleanup

If we're trying to delete a dhcp/qrouter device with use_veth
= False (Which is the default for some time), we'll first
try to 'ip link del %s', which will fail and emit a confusing
error, then try 'ovs-vsctl del-port'. There's no need to
log an error in such a case.

The patch attempts to future proof by setting the
set_log_fail_as_error(False) to be as tight as possible, so we
do log errors in case the device is somehow used in the future.

Change-Id: I1954bde3ee9a2e43d7615717134b61c5fa7cfbb1
Closes-Bug: #1463800
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/22/254422/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: device.set_log_fail_as_error(False) device.set_log_fail_as_error(True) finally: device.set_log_fail_as_error(True)

commit_message:
neutron: only get port id when listing ports in validate_networks

The validate_networks method is called from the compute API before
casting off to build instances. If the project has a lot of ports, the
list call to neutron can be slow, so we should optimize this method as
much as possible. One way to do that is rather than get the port details
back, we just get the id since all we care about is the number of ports
assigned to the project.

Closes-Bug: #1521788

Change-Id: Icddba161112526dde23184ee80ad5cb60fe66cc6

commit_message:
neutron: only list ports if there is a quota limit when validating

The list_ports call can take awhile if the project has a lot of ports.
If it turns out that there is unlimited quota, then we don't even need
to list the ports, so move that after the show_quota call.

Partial-Bug: #1521788

Change-Id: I4d128f182283ffa4479934f640a67d9c536824b5

commit_message:
Config options: centralize section "scheduler"

This change moves all of the configuration options previously defined in
nova/scheduler to the new centralized nova/conf/scheduler directory.

A subsequent patch will then improve the help texts.

Blueprint centralize-config-options
Change-Id: I08d50e873f71601a26ce768feac635243d0570f4

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg DEFAULT_DRIVER = "nova.scheduler.filter_scheduler.FilterScheduler" sched_driver_opt = cfg.StrOpt("scheduler_driver", default=DEFAULT_DRIVER, help= """Driver to use for the scheduler. The driver is the way that a selection is made from available resources when a request is received. Different drivers use different algorithms for matching a request to a resource provider. For example, the ChanceScheduler simply picks a host at random., while the FilterScheduler applies a series of pass/fail tests to the collection of hosts to reject unsuitable hosts, and then applies a series of weighers to determine the best fit. To use a different driver than the default, specify that driver's entry point in nova.conf. """), sched_driver_period_opt = cfg.IntOpt("scheduler_driver_task_period", default=60, help= """Interval for scheduler driver tasks. This value controls how often (in seconds) to run periodic tasks in the scheduler driver of your choice. The specific tasks that are run for each period are determined by the particular driver in use. Please note that there is a setting in nova/service for 'service_down_time', that relies on signals from the various services that they are still active. For the scheduler, these signals come from the drivers, usually during their periodic tasks, so changing this value to a longer interval than the service_down_time value may result in nova thinking that the scheduler service has died. As each driver can work a little differently than the others, be sure to test this with your selected driver. """) ALL_OPTS = [sched_driver_opt, sched_driver_period_opt, ] def register_opts(conf): conf.register_opts(ALL_OPTS)
